info.title: Oracle Utilities REST API for Work and Asset
info.description: This documentation helps you to get started using the REST APIs for Oracle Utilities Work and Asset Cloud Service and Oracle Utilities Work and Asset Management.
info.x-summary: This documentation helps you to get started using the REST APIs for Oracle Utilities Work and Asset Cloud Service and Oracle Utilities Work and Asset Management.

tags.name: Work Activity
tags.description: A work activity is a specific task that needs to be planned, scheduled, and completed. For example, activities can be created for routine maintenance of assets or to fix or replace failed assets. The following details on the work activity control key aspects of the task. The type of work to be performed, for example whether it's routine preventive maintenance. A time window, during which the activity is preferred to be worked on. The resources, including craft, equipment, material and so on, that are required and the quantity for each resource.

post.description: This REST service synchronizes Enterprise Resource Planning Blanket Contracts with Work and Asset Management.

This REST service synchronizes Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Chart of Accounts with Work and Asset Management Cost Center and Expense Codes, by creating Work and Asset Management Cost Center Ongoing Data Synchronization objects to process the requests.
This REST service synchronizes an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Purchase Order with the Work and Asset Management Purchase Order inbound integration object.

put.description: This REST service synchronizes Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) - Human Capital Management (HCM) Jobs with Work and Asset Management (WAM) Crafts, by creating WAM Craft records or updating existing records.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: A unique identifier of the leave record as represented in the external system  - Human Capital Management

parameters.name: externalSystem
parameters.description: The Work and Asset Management code that represents the external system.

post.description: A stock item sync request record manages the creation or update of a stock item.

put.description: This REST web service synchronizes Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) - Human Capital Management (HCM) Absence with a Work and Asset Management Employee Unavailability. This web service creates WAM Employee Unavailability creates new or updates existing records.

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: A unique identifier of the leave record as represented in the external system  - Human Capital Management

post.description: This REST service synchronizes Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Suppliers with Work and Asset Management Vendor and Vendor Locations, by creating Work and Asset Management Vendor Location Data Synchronization objects.
This REST service synchronizes Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Invoice and Payments with Work and Asset Management, by creating Work and Asset Management Invoice inbound integration objects.
This REST web service synchronizes Enterprise Resource Planning - Human Capital Management Employee records with Work and Asset Management.

patch.description: Updates the scheduling window of activities. There is a work window start date/time through a work window end date/time that can be updated from other external systems that manage enterprise project planning.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: System generated primary key up to 14 numeric digit identifier for the work activity record.

200.description: Success response. The request was successfully completed. A 200 status is returned for a successful PATCH method.

400.description: Bad Request. The request could not be processed because it contains missing or invalid information (such as a validation error on an input field, a missing required value, and so on).

500.description: Internal Server Error. The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

get.description: Retrieves activity details for project planning, not including attachments.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: System generated primary key up to 14 numeric digit identifier for the work activity record.

200.description: Success response. The request was successfully completed. A 200 status is returned for a successful GET method.

400.description: Bad Request. The request could not be processed because it contains missing or invalid information (such as a validation error on an input field, a missing required value, and so on).

500.description: Internal Server Error. The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

problemType.description: URL of the format "A/message/X/Y" where A is the base URI, X is the Message Category and Y is the Message Number within Oracle Utilities Application Framework.

httpStatus.description: The HTTP Status code for the error.

detail.description: The long message description from the Oracle Utilities Application Framework in CDATA format.

problemInstance.description: Fully qualified URL consisting of the Base URI Timestamp of error in ISO format, the User used for the transaction, the Message Category within Oracle Utilities Application Framework, the Message Number within Oracle Utilities Application Framework, the Request URL and the HTTP method used for the transaction.

stackTrace.description: The stack trace shows where the error occurs during the execution of a program.

messageCategory.description: Message Category within Oracle Utilities Application Framework.

messageNbr.description: Message Number within Oracle Utilities Application Framework.

programName.description: Name of the program that encountered the error.

messageText.description: Fully qualified error message from Oracle Utilities Application Framework in CDATA format.

longDescription.description: The long message description from the Oracle Utilities Application Framework in CDATA format.

externalSystem.description: The default value for the Enterprise Resource Planning Integration. You can retrieve the correct value from the property name wacs.externalsystem in the ERPWACS_ConfigProps file. This value must be defined for Work and Asset Management to function properly.

externalReferenceId.description: Represents Enterprise Resource Planning's unique system-generated item ID. Work and Asset Management's externalReferenceId and resourceTypeExternalId use the same value.

blanketContractNumber.description: Unique number for the Blanket Contract.

revisionNumber.description: The revision number of the Blanket Contract.

status.description: Current Status of the Blanket Contract. BLanket Contract can support the following status states: Created, Awaiting Activation, Active, Closed, and Suspended, respectively. As long as the blanket contract is in an Active status, it can be referenced by new purchasing documents to order materials or services. Contracts can be set to a Suspended status so that they are temporarily unavailable for new purchases. This might be used while re-negotiating terms with a vendor, if you are researching new vendors for a particular item or service, or for other business requirements.

description.description: Brief description of the Blanket Contract.

blanketCategory.description:
The category field provides information indicating the type of contract such as whether it is for goods or services.
* `ZZBP` - Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA),
* `ZZCP` - Contract Purchase Agreement (CPA)

creationDateTime.description: Date and Time when the Blanket Contract was initiated.

limitAmount.description: The dollar value limit for the contract.

initiationDate.description: The initiation date is the first date the blanket contract can be used.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date indicates the date by which the contract must be renegotiated.

fob.description: Free on board code. This field is controlled by the Free on Board portal.

creationDateTime.description: Date and Time when the Blanket Contract was initiated.

description.description: Brief description of the Blanket Contract.

allowOnPo.description:
Indicates whether or not the item can be included on the purchase order or requisition when it is created from the blanket contract. The item does not appear on the item pick list if it is not allowed. This indicator is used in higher revisions where certain items may cease to be covered by the blanket contract.
* `W1AL` - Yes,
* `W1NA` - No

externalSystem.description: The default value for the Enterprise Resource Planning Integration. You can retrieve the correct value from the property name wacs.externalsystem in the ERPWACS_ConfigProps file. This value must be defined for Work and Asset Management to function properly.

externalReferenceId.description: Represents Enterprise Resource Planning's unique system-generated item ID. Work and Asset Management's externalReferenceId and resourceTypeExternalId use the same value.

revisionNumber.description: The revision number of the Blanket Contract.

status.description: Current Status of the Blanket Contract. BLanket Contract can support the following status states: Created, Awaiting Activation, Active, Closed, and Suspended, respectively. As long as the blanket contract is in an Active status, it can be referenced by new purchasing documents to order materials or services. Contracts can be set to a Suspended status so that they are temporarily unavailable for new purchases. This might be used while re-negotiating terms with a vendor, if you are researching new vendors for a particular item or service, or for other business requirements.

initialLoad.description: On initial load, chart of accounts that are in an active status are synced from Oracle Enterprise Resource Planning Financials. For incremental sync actions, active and inactive chart of accounts records are synced from Oracle Enterprise Resource Planning Financials.

status.description: Status of the Cost Center based on business object lifecycle.

description.description: Description for the cost center, which provides additional context.

segment1.description: Enterprise Resource Planning segment 1 represents Company. Enterprise Resource Planning segments are mapped to the EBO (Enterprise Business Object) chart of accounts GL (General Ledger) elements list and passed to the Work and Asset Management segment elements.

segment1Description.description: Enterprise Resource Planning segment 1 description to provide additional details on the company information.

segment2.description: Enterprise Resource Planning segment 2 represents LOB (Line of Business).

segment2Description.description: Enterprise Resource Planning segment 2 description to provide additional details on the line of business information.

segment3.description: Enterprise Resource Planning segment 3 represents Expense Code

segment3Description.description: Enterprise Resource Planning segment 3  description to provide additional details on the expense code information.

segment4.description: Enterprise Resource Planning segment 4 represents Cost Center

segment4Description.description: Enterprise Resource Planning segment 4  description to provide additional details on the cost center information.

segment5.description: Enterprise Resource Planning segment 5 represents Product

segment5Description.description: Enterprise Resource Planning segment 5 description to provide additional details on the product information.

segment6Description.description: Enterprise Resource Planning Segment 6  description to provide additional details on the intercompany information.

status.description: Status of the purchase order based on business object lifecycle.

purchaseOrderNumber.description: Enterprise Resource Planning system-generated Purchase Order number.

revisionNumber.description: Identification number for revisions to a purchase order.

description.description: Descriptive information about the revision.

creationDateTime.description: The creation date & time of the purchase order. If left blank, it's defaulted to system date & time when it's created in Work and Asset Management.

issueDate.description: The approval date or the issue date for the purchase order. Integration passes the current date.

requiredDate.description: The date a purchase order is required by the requestor.

shipToLocation.description: Storeroom location where the goods are shipped.

deliverToLocation.description: Storeroom location where the goods are delivered.

address1.description: The first line for the address, associated with the Purchase Order.

address2.description: The second line for the address, associated with the Purchase Order.

address3.description: The third line for the address, associated with the Purchase Order.

address4.description: The fourth line for the address, associated with the Purchase Order.

crossStreet.description: The Cross Street the PO address

houseType.description: The House Type for the PO address

number1.description: Address number 1 for the PO address

number2.description: Address number 2 for the PO address

geographicCode.description: The Geographic Code for the PO address

inCityLimit.description: Indicates whether or not this address is within the taxing boundary of the jurisdiction that's provided in the address.

city.description: The City for the PO address

suburb.description: The Suburb for the PO address

county.description: The County for the PO address

state.description: The Postal Code for the PO address

postal.description: The Postal Code for the PO address

country.description: The Country Code for the PO address

exchangeRate.description: The rate to convert the currency code values to the default currency.

freeOnBoard.description: Determines the costs involved in the delivery of goods.

paymentTerms.description: Payment terms between payee and vendor.

purchaseDocumentType.description:
Indicates where the purchase order is being generated from.
* `W1GP` - General Purchase,
* `W1SR` - Store Replenishment

status.description: Status of the purchase order based on business object lifecycle.

description.description: Descriptive information about the revision.

lineNumber.description: The number referencing each Purchase Order Line. These should be unique between lines.

purchaseRequisitionLineId.description: Work and Asset Management Purchase Requisition Line ID sent out during the Purchase Requisition Sync.

blanketContractLineNumber.description: The number referencing each Purchase Order Line. These should be unique between lines.

requiredDate.description: The date a purchase order is required by the requestor.

externalSystem.description: The Work and Asset Management code that represents the external system.

externalId.description: A unique identifier to the craft as represented in the external system  - Human Capital Management

description.description: Short description for a type of craft resource. Typically a special skill or contract worker

longDescription.description: Long description for a type of craft resource. Typically a special skill or contract worker

resourceSource.description:
Provides a reference to where the craft resource can be located or obtained. Internal or Purchased.
* `W1IN` - Internal,
* `W1PR` - Purchased

defaultValueToActivity.description:
Indicates whether or not the item information should be defaulted onto activities when resource requirements reference the craft. If this is set to No, then the stock item can only be added to stock item details as a direct purchase item.
* `W1NO` - No,
* `W1YS` - Yes

acceptOnReceipt.description:
Applies to contracted resources to indicate whether or not the system can automatically accept the work, or service, without someone reviewing or accepting it manually.
* `W1NO` - No,
* `W1YS` - Yes

schedulePriority.description: A numerical value which is used to denote the order in which the principal craft duration is determined when labor requirement assignments are made to a secondary craft. 1 is a high priority and 999 is a low priority. The default is 100. If two crafts have the same secondary craft, they should be set with different priorities.

effectiveDate.description: Date when the Unit Price goes into effect

regularExpenseCode.description: Regular expense code for the craft

premiumExpenseCode.description: Premium expense code for the craft

craftId.description: Unique ID sent by Work and Asset Management System on each outbound message

externalSystem.description: The Work and Asset Management code that represents the external system.

externalId.description: A unique identifier to the craft as represented in the external system  - Human Capital Management

description.description: Short description for a type of craft resource. Typically a special skill or contract worker

longDescription.description: Long description for a type of craft resource. Typically a special skill or contract worker

resourceSource.description:
Provides a reference to where the craft resource can be located or obtained. Internal or Purchased.
* `W1IN` - Internal,
* `W1PR` - Purchased

defaultValueToActivity.description:
Indicates whether or not the item information should be defaulted onto activities when resource requirements reference the craft. If this is set to No, then the stock item can only be added to stock item details as a direct purchase item.
* `W1NO` - No,
* `W1YS` - Yes

acceptOnReceipt.description:
Applies to contracted resources to indicate whether or not the system can automatically accept the work, or service, without someone reviewing or accepting it manually.
* `W1NO` - No,
* `W1YS` - Yes

schedulePriority.description: A numerical value which is used to denote the order in which the principal craft duration is determined when labor requirement assignments are made to a secondary craft. 1 is a high priority and 999 is a low priority. The default is 100. If two crafts have the same secondary craft, they should be set with different priorities.

effectiveDate.description: Date when the Unit Price goes into effect

regularExpenseCode.description: Regular expense code for the craft

premiumExpenseCode.description: Premium expense code for the craft

craftId.description: Unique ID sent by Work and Asset Management System on each outbound message

externalSystem.description: The default value for the Enterprise Resource Planning Integration. You can retrieve the correct value from the property name wacs.externalsystem in the ERPWACS_ConfigProps file. This value must be defined for Work and Asset Management to function properly.

externalReferenceId.description: Represents Enterprise Resource Planning's unique system-generated item ID. Work and Asset Management's externalReferenceId and resourceTypeExternalId use the same value.

initialLoad.description: Indicates how the sync request is initiated by the external system, for example by a mass load like conversion.

boStatus.description: Status of the item based on business object lifecycle.

statusReason.description: Additional information about why a stock item transitioned to a new status.

description.description: Brief description up to 100 characters for the stock item.

longDescription.description: Longer description up to 4000 characters for the stock item.

stockItem.description: The unique record IDs of the stock item, used as the stock code in Work and Asset Management.

inventoryExpenseCode.description: Indicates the expense code that will be charged for costs related to the storeroom housing the stock item. If specified, it overrides the Inventory Expense Code on the storeroom.

usageExpenseCode.description: Indicates the expense code that will be charged for costs related to the stock item being utilized.

propertyUnit.description: Property units are associated with stock items to indicate when a compatible unit of that stock item is built and should be used to create a fixed asset.

unitPrice.description: The average unit price at the unit of issue. Users can update it for a brand new stock item for a cost estimate.

commodityCategory.description: The highest level, or most general categorization of an item.

commodityName.description: For each category, there is a unique list of Commodity Names.

commodityType.description: For each category and name combination, there is a unique list of Commodity Types.

commodityComposition.description: For each category, name, and type combination, there is a unique list of Commodity Compositions. The composition code is used to indicate the primary material in the item.

commoditySize.description: Commodity Size ID (number) provided by ERP

stockCategory.description: Categorization for stock items based on your organization's business practices.

hazardous.description: Indicates whether the item may be hazardous in some way.

hazardousType.description: Indicates the type of hazard for hazardous items.

shelfLife.description: Indicates the number of days that perishable items can remain in stores before it is no longer useful.

capitalSpare.description: Indicates whether the item is a relatively valuable piece of equipment kept in the house as a backup if the item in use should fail. Items such as a spare motor or generator might fall into this category.

trackable.description: Indicates whether the item is trackable. Trackable stock items merit being individually identified and followed from initial receipt on-site through complete usage. These are typically large, expensive, or specialized assets or materials, which are inspected when they are received into inventory, repaired if they break, can be installed on other assets, and are otherwise carefully dispositioned in the system.

repairable.description: Indicates whether or not the item is eligible to be repaired, should it fail.

unitOfPurchase.description: The Unit of Purchase defines the type of unit used to order an item, such as BOX. The system uses the Unit of Purchase, Unit of Issue, and Purchase to Issue Ratio information to maintain quantities as parts are issued and new parts are received. You may, for instance, issue in individual items but order the items by the box where one box would contain 10 individual items. In this scenario, the Unit of Purchase is BOX, the Unit of Issue is Each, and the Purchase to Issue Ratio is 10.

unitOfIssue.description: The Unit of Issue defines the type of unit used to issue an item.The system uses the Unit of Purchase, Unit of Issue, and Purchase to Issue Ratio information to maintain quantities as parts are issued and new parts are received. You may, for instance, issue in individual items but order the items by the box where one box would contain 10 individual items. In this scenario, the Unit of Purchase is BOX, the Unit of Issue is Each, and the Purchase to Issue Ratio is 10.

purchaseToIssueRatio.description: The system calculates the Purchase to Issue Ratio using the Unit of Purchase by the Unit of Issue. For instance, issue in individual items but order the items by the box where one box would contain 10 individual items. The Unit of Purchase would then be BOX, the Unit of Issue would be EACH, and the P-I ratio would be 10.

taxRateSchedule.description: Indicates the tax schedule applicable to the purchase. The drop-down list is defined by entries in the Tax Rate Schedule portal.

purchaseCommodity.description: The commodity classification for the stock item.

doNotSubstitute.description: Indicates that you do not want the vendor to substitute the item with an alternate.

defaultValueToActivity.description: Indicates whether or not the stock item information should default onto activities when resource requirements reference the stock item. If this is set to No, then the stock item can only be added to stock item details as a direct purchase item.

vendorLocationId.description: One or many vendor locations are defined for each vendor to distinguish between multiple vendor sites. Each location provides more detailed information about the vendor site such as an address, capabilities, payment details, contacts, and so on.

vendorPartNumber.description: A number that uniquely identifies the supplier part.

vendorPriority.description: Used to denote which is the primary supplier of the item. At least one vendor must be set as primary.

manufacturerCode.description: Display the manufacturer of the asset.

copyToPO.description: Indicates whether a manufacturer should be copied to a purchasing document when it references this particular stock item.

manufacturerPartNumber.description: A number that uniquely identifies the manufacturer part

bomId.description: A Bill of Material (BOM) is a list containing a hierarchy of component parts that make up a piece of equipment or asset. The component parts, also known as BOM Parts, are the individual stock items or an assembly of stock items included in the BOM

problemType.description: URL of the format 'A/message/X/Y' where A is the base URI, X is the Message Category and Y is the Message Number within Oracle Utilities Application Framework.

httpStatus.description: The HTTP Status code for the error.

externalSystem.description: The default value for the Enterprise Resource Planning Integration. You can retrieve the correct value from the property name wacs.externalsystem in the ERPWACS_ConfigProps file. This value must be defined for Work and Asset Management to function properly.

externalReferenceId.description: Represents Enterprise Resource Planning's unique system-generated item ID. Work and Asset Management's externalReferenceId and resourceTypeExternalId use the same value.

initialLoad.description: Indicates how the sync request is initiated by the external system, for example by a mass load like conversion.

boStatus.description: Status of the item based on business object lifecycle.

statusReason.description: Additional information about why a stock item transitioned to a new status.

description.description: Brief description up to 100 characters for the stock item.

longDescription.description: Longer description up to 4000 characters for the stock item.

stockItem.description: The unique record IDs of the stock item, used as the stock code in Work and Asset Management.

inventoryExpenseCode.description: Indicates the expense code that will be charged for costs related to the storeroom housing the stock item. If specified, it overrides the Inventory Expense Code on the storeroom.

usageExpenseCode.description: Indicates the expense code that will be charged for costs related to the stock item being utilized.

propertyUnit.description: Property units are associated with stock items to indicate when a compatible unit of that stock item is built and should be used to create a fixed asset.

unitPrice.description: The average unit price at the unit of issue. Users can update it for a brand new stock item for a cost estimate.

commodityCategory.description: The highest level, or most general categorization of an item.

commodityName.description: For each category, there is a unique list of Commodity Names.

commodityType.description: For each category and name combination, there is a unique list of Commodity Types.

commodityComposition.description: For each category, name, and type combination, there is a unique list of Commodity Compositions. The composition code is used to indicate the primary material in the item.

commoditySize.description: Commodity Size ID (number) provided by ERP

stockCategory.description: Categorization for stock items based on your organization's business practices.

hazardous.description: Indicates whether the item may be hazardous in some way.

hazardousType.description: Indicates the type of hazard for hazardous items.

shelfLife.description: Indicates the number of days that perishable items can remain in stores before it is no longer useful.

capitalSpare.description: Indicates whether the item is a relatively valuable piece of equipment kept in the house as a backup if the item in use should fail. Items such as a spare motor or generator might fall into this category.

trackable.description: Indicates whether the item is trackable. Trackable stock items merit being individually identified and followed from initial receipt on-site through complete usage. These are typically large, expensive, or specialized assets or materials, which are inspected when they are received into inventory, repaired if they break, can be installed on other assets, and are otherwise carefully dispositioned in the system.

repairable.description: Indicates whether or not the item is eligible to be repaired, should it fail.

unitOfPurchase.description: The Unit of Purchase defines the type of unit used to order an item, such as BOX. The system uses the Unit of Purchase, Unit of Issue, and Purchase to Issue Ratio information to maintain quantities as parts are issued and new parts are received. You may, for instance, issue in individual items but order the items by the box where one box would contain 10 individual items. In this scenario, the Unit of Purchase is BOX, the Unit of Issue is Each, and the Purchase to Issue Ratio is 10.

unitOfIssue.description: The Unit of Issue defines the type of unit used to issue an item.The system uses the Unit of Purchase, Unit of Issue, and Purchase to Issue Ratio information to maintain quantities as parts are issued and new parts are received. You may, for instance, issue in individual items but order the items by the box where one box would contain 10 individual items. In this scenario, the Unit of Purchase is BOX, the Unit of Issue is Each, and the Purchase to Issue Ratio is 10.

purchaseToIssueRatio.description: The system calculates the Purchase to Issue Ratio using the Unit of Purchase by the Unit of Issue. For instance, issue in individual items but order the items by the box where one box would contain 10 individual items. The Unit of Purchase would then be BOX, the Unit of Issue would be EACH, and the Purchase to Issue ratio would be 10.

taxRateSchedule.description: Indicates the tax schedule applicable to the purchase. The drop-down list is defined by entries in the Tax Rate Schedule portal.

purchaseCommodity.description: The commodity classification for the stock item.

doNotSubstitute.description: Indicates that you do not want the vendor to substitute the item with an alternate.

defaultValueToActivity.description: Indicates whether or not the stock item information should default onto activities when resource requirements reference the stock item. If this is set to No, then the stock item can only be added to stock item details as a direct purchase item.

vendorLocationId.description: One or many vendor locations are defined for each vendor to distinguish between multiple vendor sites. Each location provides more detailed information about the vendor site such as an address, capabilities, payment details, contacts, and so on.

vendorPartNumber.description: A number that uniquely identifies the supplier part.

vendorPriority.description: Used to denote which is the primary supplier of the item. At least one vendor must be set as primary.

manufacturerCode.description: Display the manufacturer of the asset.

copyToPO.description: Indicates whether a manufacturer should be copied to a purchasing document when it references this particular stock item.

manufacturerPartNumber.description: A number that uniquely identifies the manufacturer part

bomId.description: A Bill of Material (BOM) is a list containing a hierarchy of component parts that make up a piece of equipment or asset. The component parts, also known as BOM Parts, are the individual stock items or an assembly of stock items included in the BOM

externalSystem.description: The Work and Asset Management code that represents the external system.

leaveType.description: Indicates the type of leave/unavailability for the employee

description.description: Short description

applicantId.description: Unique identification for the employee for integration with external systems.

status.description: Status of the Applicant record. The status can be set to one of the following values: Active, Approved, Canceled, Created, Expired, Pending Approval, Rejected

startDateTime.description: Indicates the start date/time period for the unavailability.

endDateTime.description: Indicates the end date/ time period for the unavailability.

externalSystem.description: The Work and Asset Management code that represents the external system.

startDateTime.description: Indicates the start date/time period for the unavailability.

endDateTime.description: Indicates the end date/ time period for the unavailability.

externalSystem.description: The default value for the Enterprise Resource Planning Integration. You can retrieve the correct value from the property name wacs.externalsystem in the ERPWACS_ConfigProps file. This value must be defined for Work and Asset Management to function properly.

externalReferenceId.description: Represents Enterprise Resource Planning's unique system-generated item ID. Work and Asset Management's externalReferenceId and resourceTypeExternalId use the same value.

initialLoad.description: Indicates how the sync request is initiated by the external system, for example by a mass load like conversion.

vendor.description: Unique identification for the vendor in Work and Asset Management. When vendor location(s) of a new vendor are synced into Work and Asset Management for the first time, a new vendor record is created with this as its primary key in the Vendor portal. This could be different from the unique identifier of the vendor in the external system.

status.description: Status of the vendor based on business object lifecycle.

creationDateTime.description: The creation date and time of the vendor location. If left blank, it is defaulted to system date and time when it is created in Work and Asset Management

orderFromFlag.description:
Indicates whether or not the vendor location accepts orders.Order From:
* `W1AL` - Allowed,
* `W1NA` - Not Allowed

payToFlag.description:
Indicates whether or not the vendor location handles its own billing.Pay To:
* `W1AL` - Allowed,
* `W1NA` - Not Allowed

paymentTerm.description: Indicates the terms for paying the vendor such as Net 30. This field is controlled by the Payment Terms portal.

minimumOrderAmount.description: Indicates a dollar amount which is the minimum the vendor location will accept for one order.

autoPay.description: Indicates that an invoice will be automatically created for the purchase order upon receipt.

carrierFlag.description:
This indicates if the location provides shipping (for example referenced on purchase orders and purchase requests as a carrier.Carrier:
* `W1NO` - No,
* `W1YS` - Yes

carrierLocationId.description: This is the location used if the location does not provide shipping. This field is required if Carrier Flag is set to No, otherwise, should not be populated.

fob.description: Free on board code. This field is controlled by the Free on Board portal.

emailPoFlag.description:
Indicates whether or not purchase orders should be emailed to this vendor location.  After the purchase order is issued, an option becomes available under Additional Processes to email the order.Email PO:
* `W1AL` - Allowed,
* `W1NA` - Not Allowed

poEmailAddress.description: The email address where purchase orders should be sent for this location. This is required if Email PO is allowed.

payTaxToVendor.description:
Pay Tax To Vendor:
* `W1NO` - No,
* `W1YS` - Yes

externalSystem.description: The default value for the Enterprise Resource Planning Integration. You can retrieve the correct value from the property name wacs.externalsystem in the ERPWACS_ConfigProps file. This value must be defined for Work and Asset Management to function properly.

externalReferenceId.description: Represents Enterprise Resource Planning's unique system-generated item ID. Work and Asset Management's externalReferenceId and resourceTypeExternalId use the same value.

initialLoad.description: Indicates how the sync request is initiated by the external system, for example by a mass load like conversion.

vendor.description: Unique identification for the vendor in Work and Asset Management. When vendor location(s) of a new vendor are synced into Work and Asset Management for the first time, a new vendor record is created with this as its primary key in the Vendor portal. This could be different from the unique identifier of the vendor in the external system.

status.description: Status of the vendor based on business object lifecycle.

creationDateTime.description: The creation date and time of the vendor location. If left blank, it is defaulted to system date and time when it is created in Work and Asset Management

orderFromFlag.description:
Indicates whether or not the vendor location accepts orders.Order From:
* `W1AL` - Allowed,
* `W1NA` - Not Allowed

payToFlag.description:
Indicates whether or not the vendor location handles its own billing.Pay To:
* `W1AL` - Allowed,
* `W1NA` - Not Allowed

paymentTerm.description: Indicates the terms for paying the vendor such as Net 30. This field is controlled by the Payment Terms portal.

minimumOrderAmount.description: Indicates a dollar amount which is the minimum the vendor location will accept for one order.

autoPay.description: Indicates that an invoice will be automatically created for the purchase order upon receipt.

carrierFlag.description:
This indicates if the location provides shipping (for example referenced on purchase orders and purchase requests as a carrier.Carrier:
* `W1NO` - No,
* `W1YS` - Yes

carrierLocationId.description: This is the location used if the location does not provide shipping. This field is required if Carrier Flag is set to No, otherwise, should not be populated.

fob.description: Free on board code. This field is controlled by the Free on Board portal.

emailPoFlag.description:
Indicates whether or not purchase orders should be emailed to this vendor location.  After the purchase order is issued, an option becomes available under Additional Processes to email the order.Email PO:
* `W1AL` - Allowed,
* `W1NA` - Not Allowed

poEmailAddress.description: The email address where purchase orders should be sent for this location. This is required if Email PO is allowed.

payTaxToVendor.description:

externalSystem.description: The default value for the Enterprise Resource Planning Integration. You can retrieve the correct value from the property name wacs.externalsystem in the ERPWACS_ConfigProps file. This value must be defined for Work and Asset Management to function properly.

externalReferenceId.description: Represents Enterprise Resource Planning's unique system-generated invoice ID. Work and Asset Management's externalReferenceId and resourceTypeExternalId use the same value.

invoiceNumber.description: This is the vendor's invoice number and it is unique for each vendor location.

description.description: Brief description up to 100 characters for the invoice.

numberOfDays.description: Payment due in number of days.

vendorDate.description: The date on which invoice is generated by vendor.

invoiceDueDate.description: Invoice Due Date - Calculated based on the terms (vendor date + Days from Terms)

paymentDate.description: The date on which payment is done

paymentType.description:
Payment Type
* `W1AP` - Regular AP Processing,
* `W1DR` - Draft,
* `W1EL` - Electronic,
* `W1MN` - Manual

purchaseOrderNumber.description: Enterprise Resource Planning system generated Purchase Order number.

description.description: Brief description up to 100 characters for the invoice.

itemType.description:
Invoice Item Type:
* `W1CP` - Credit for Price Adjustment,
* `W1CR` - Credit for Quantity Adjustment,
* `W1DS` - Discount,
* `W1FR` - Freight,
* `W1NR` - Normal,
* `W1TX` - Tax,
* `W1XR` - Extra Cost

externalSystem.description: Defaulted (value) by the HCM Integration.

externalReferenceId.description: Variable based on the originating system

businessUnit.description: The business unit that the employee belongs to. Generally costs incurred by the employee roll up to this business unit.

creationUser.description: The system username for the employee. Employees do not necessarily have to be defined as users within the system.

supervisor.description: The username of the employee's supervisor

principalCraft.description: The main craft that the employee is qualified to work.

address1.description: The first line for the address, associated with the Purchase Order.

address2.description: The second line for the address, associated with the Purchase Order.

address3.description: The third line for the address, associated with the Purchase Order.

address4.description: The fourth line for the address, associated with the Purchase Order.

crossStreet.description: The Cross Street the PO address.

houseType.description: The House Type for the PO address.

geographicCode.description: The Geographic Code for the PO address.

city.description: The City for the PO address.

suburb.description: The Suburb for the PO address.

county.description: The County for the PO address.

postal.description: The Postal Code for the PO address.

phoneType.description:
Phone number type
* `FAX ` - Fax,
* `SMS ` - Short Message Service,
* `W1BS` - Business,
* `W1HM` - Home,
* `W1MB` - Mobile,
* `W1PR` - Primary
